question: Which country was the target location of the "Operation Eagle Claw" ordered by the United States of America in 1980?
explanation: Iran was the target location of the "Operation Eagle Claw" ordered by the United States of America in 1980. Operation Eagle Claw, known as Operation Tabas in Iran, was a United States Armed Forces operation ordered by U.S. President Jimmy Carter to attempt to end the Iran hostage crisis by rescuing 52 embassy staff held captive at the Embassy of the United States, Tehran on 24 April 1980.
